alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Donley; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 11:20AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Armstrong, southeastern Carson, southwestern Gray and northwestern Donley Counties through NOON CDT... At 1120 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Claude, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Claude, Groom, Lake Mcclellan, and Goodnight. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
